snippet: A pipeline through which oil once flowed west will instead take diluted bitumen and conventional oil from western Canada to Montreal, traversing the United States in the process.
abstract: Canada's National Energy Board approves reversal of a major pipeline, which will allow diluted oil sands bitumen and conventional oil from country’s west to travel across the United States through pipelines owned by Enbridge to the border at Sarnia, Ontario; decision is rare boost for Canada's energy producers in their efforts to expand the market for oil sands bitumen.
lead_paragraph: A pipeline through which oil once flowed west will instead take diluted bitumen and conventional oil from western Canada to Montreal, traversing the United States in the process.

headline.main: Canadian Oil Will Take New Route Across U.S.
headline.print_headline: Canadian Oil Will Take New Route Across U.S.
